org.divxdede.swing.busy.icon
Class AbstractBusyIcon

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      org.divxdede.swing.busy.icon.AbstractBusyIcon
All Implemented Interfaces:
Icon, BusyIcon
Direct Known Subclasses:
DecoratorBusyIcon, InfiniteBusyIcon
public abstract class AbstractBusyIcon
extends Observable
implements BusyIcon

An implementation of the BusyIcon interface to serve as a basis for implementing various kinds of Busy Icons.

At this level, this class give some features for make BusyIcon implementation easier:

  • Paints method for various states of icons (determinate,undeterminate,idle)
  • Common implementation for storing either a simple BoundedRangeModel or a more featured BusyModel
  • Buffer Image cache for optimize repaint's event from BoundedRangeModel changes : setUseCache(boolean), getSignificantRatioOffset()
  • Automatic frame rate mecanism for render undeterminate state animation : setUndeterminateFrameRate(int, int)
  • Provide a repaint(boolean) for subclasses use when they needs to send a repaint event
  • Extends Observable providing a delegate mecanism for repaint's event

    • This implementation provide 3 methods to implements for render a busy icon:

    • paintDeterminate(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, int, int, float) for render a determinate state with the specified ratio of the current progression
    • paintUndeterminate(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, int, int, int) for render an undeterminate state with the specified frame
    • paintIdle(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, int, int) for render an idle state (not busy)

    This icon accept generic BoundedRangeModel or mode specific BusyModel.
    When this icon is bound to a generic BoundedRangeModel, this icon is always considered in a determinate state.
    But if this icon is bound to a BusyModel, this model can control the busy state or the determinate/undeterminate state.

    The buffer image cache is done for optimize painting process when this icon state are unchanged.
    Instead of call real paints method each time, this abstract implementation use a previously rendered image of this icon.
    In the other side, subclasses must implements getSignificantRatioOffset() in the way to help this implementation determine if the current buffer image cache is up to date regarding the current state of this icon.
    In the other-side, this implementation help us to prevent from various change from the BoundedRangeModel. Theses models can have data range that can be large, and any minor change will fire a repaint event even if the change don't be significant in the ui representation. That's why, you should implements the getSignificantRatioOffset() accordingly to your ui.

    When this busy icon is on an undeterminate state, an internal timer will fire repaint events periodically.
    The paintUndeterminate(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, int, int, int) method will be used for rendering this icon.
    The provided frame number is incremented each paint event and is cyclic accordingly to the configuration done by setUndeterminateFrameRate(int, int).
    This method should be used by subclasses in order to configure the undeterminate frame rate animation.

    A protected repaint(boolean) method is provided for subclasses when they need to fire a repaint event.
    This method call a Component.repaint() on each components registered on this icon.
    Registered components are all components specified to the paintIcon(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, int, int).
    In the other side, you can specify an Observer to this icon. If it's the case, components are not registered and only observer will receive repaint's event.

    This class don't give any basic implementation for Icon.getIconWidth() and Icon.getIconHeight() and must be implemented by subclasses.

    Since:
    1.1
    Author:
    André Sébastien (divxdede)

    y - Upper left corner (vertical value)

    paintUndeterminate

    protected abstract void paintUndeterminate(Component c,
                                           Graphics g,
                                           int x,
                                           int y,
                                           int frame)
    Paint this icon in an undeterminate state.
    Regarding configuration set with setUndeterminateFrameRate(int, int), this method will be invoked periodically when this icon need to render an undeterminate state.
    The given frame number is a cyclic counter in range [0 ~ frameCount - 1].

    Parameters:
    c - Component using this icon
    g - Graphics to paint on
    x - Upper left corner (horizontal value)
    y - Upper left corner (vertical value)
    frame - Current undeterminate frame number

    paintIdle

    protected abstract void paintIdle(Component c,
                                  Graphics g,
                                  int x,
                                  int y)
    Paint this icon in an idle state.
    An idle state mean that this icon is not currently busy and this icon should not paint any related information from the Data Model

    Parameters:
    c - Component using this icon
    g - Graphics to paint on
    x - Upper left corner (horizontal value)
    y - Upper left corner (vertical value)

    getSignificantRatioOffset

    protected abstract float getSignificantRatioOffset()
    Return the minimum advance to reach by the BoundedRangeModel between two paint's requests in order to discard the current buffer image (cache) and update this icon with the current state.

    The BoundedRangeModel can have a large length between it's minimum and maximum values. When this length is large, this icon may receive a lot of repaint's events.
    All of theses event's should not be forwarded if theses event's don't perform a significant difference into this icon.

    By exemple, a progress bar of 50 pixels should serve a repaint event if some pixels changes. The significant ratio offset should be 1/50 = 0.02f
    In this case, this icon will be updated each time at least a pixel change inside the progress bar.

    If you render a progress bar with a radial representation, typically you can return a significant ratio offset of 1/360.
    In this case, this icon will be updated each time at least a degree change inside the radial representation.

    This information are used only in conjunction of the buffer image provided with useCache() and setUseCache(boolean) methods.
    If the image cache is disabled, all repaint events notified by the BoundedRangeModel will be forwarded.

    Returns:
    Minimum ratio offset that must be reach by the BoundedRangeModel between to paint processes. Can be set to 0 for serve all paint's requests
    See Also:
    useCache(), setUseCache(boolean), getRatio()

    setModel

    public void setModel(BoundedRangeModel model)
    Define the BoundedRangeModel used for render this icon progression.

    If the BoundedRangeModel is a BusyModel, this icon will use attributes like BusyModel.isBusy() and BusyModel.isDeterminate() for render this icon.

    Specified by:
    setModel in interface BusyIcon
    Parameters:
    model - BoundedRangeModel to bound to this icon (can be null)

    getModel

    public BoundedRangeModel getModel()
    Return the current BoundedRangeModel used for render this icon progression.

    If the BoundedRangeModel is a BusyModel, this icon will use attributes like BusyModel.isBusy() and BusyModel.isDeterminate() for render this icon.

    Specified by:
    getModel in interface BusyIcon
    Returns:
    The underlying BoundedRangeModel (may be null)

    isDeterminate

    public boolean isDeterminate()
    Indicate if this icon is rendering a determinate or undeterminate progression.

    This attribute can be data-driven by a BusyModel set into setModel(javax.swing.BoundedRangeModel).
    Any other instances of BoundedRangeModel will be considered as determinate.

    Specified by:
    isDeterminate in interface BusyIcon
    Returns:
    true if this icon render a determinate progression, false otherwise

    isBusy

    public boolean isBusy()
    Indicate if this icon is rendering a busy state.

    This attribute can be data-driven by a BusyModel set into setModel(javax.swing.BoundedRangeModel).
    Any other instances of BoundedRangeModel will be considered as busy.

    Returns:
    true if this icon render a busy state, false otherwise

    paintIcon

    public final void paintIcon(Component c,
                            Graphics g,
                            int x,
                            int y)
    Paint this icon.

    This method can use an image buffer for render quickly this icon if no significant change is available since the last paint process.
    You can enable or disable this behaviour with the setUseCache(boolean) method.

    When using a buffer image cache, this implementation must determine if the current image is up to date and can be used instead of perform a full painting process. This determination are done using the getSignificantRatioOffset() information.

    Specified by:
    paintIcon in interface Icon
    Parameters:
    c - Component using this icon
    g - Graphics to paint on
    x - Upper left corner (horizontal value)
    y - Upper left corner (vertical value)

    useCache

    public boolean useCache()
    Indicate if this icon is able to use a buffer image for painting code when the context allow it.

    Returns:
    true if this icon use a buffer image for optimize render.

    setUseCache

    public void setUseCache(boolean enable)
    Define if this icon should use or note a buffer image for painting process for optimization.

    Parameters:
    enable - true for enable buffer image, false otherwise

    repaint

    protected void repaint(boolean force)
    Request a paint update on any components that are previously painted this icon.

    This method check the buffer-image up to date and if it's the case, the repaint will be ignored unless the force attribute is at true.

    Parameters:
    force - true for serve a repaint in all cases.
